meanings.definition: To emit a strong, unpleasant odor.
meanings.sent1: The garbage began to reak in the hot sun.
meanings.sent2: The old socks reak after a long day of wear.
meanings.sent3: The reaking trash made everyone hold their noses.
meanings.sent4: The reaking stench filled the entire room.
meanings.sent5: The reak from the skunk was overpowering.

meanings.sent1: The reak from the garbage was unbearable.
meanings.sent2: There was a reak of rotten eggs in the kitchen.
meanings.sent3: The reak in the room made everyone wrinkle their noses.
meanings.sent4: The reak of failure hung heavy in the air.
meanings.sent5: The reak of smoke lingered long after the fire was out.

meanings.definition: To give off a strong, offensive odor.
meanings.sent1: The flowers reak with a sweet fragrance.
meanings.sent2: The cheese began to reak as it aged.
meanings.sent3: The reaking perfume filled the room with a floral scent.
meanings.sent4: The reaking garbage truck passed by, leaving a trail of odor.
meanings.sent5: The reaking skunk sprayed its scent in defense.

meanings.sent1: The reak of fish at the market was overwhelming.
meanings.sent2: There was a reak of sewage near the drain.
meanings.sent3: The reak of burnt popcorn wafted through the office.
meanings.sent4: The reak of fear filled the room as the storm approached.
meanings.sent5: The reak of success was in the air after the team won the game.
